intro: Barkhausia canescens, commonly known as the whitebark lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces attractive, globe-shaped seed capsules. Barkhausia canescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
